glsa.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, allowing remote attackers to disclose sensitive information and complete weak handshakes.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the upstream advisory and CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could disclose a serverâ€™s private DH exponent, or complete SSLv2 handshakes using ciphers that have been disabled on the server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
